title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 2,958.90 USD/T on December 19, 2025, marking a 1.47% increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 5.20%, and are up 16.35% year-over-year. The market is hovering near a one-month high, supported by improving demand prospects and tight global supply.

title: Aluminium prices rally near USD 2960/t as markets tighten toward year-end
summary: LME aluminium prices rose sharply to approximately USD 2,958.90 per tonne on December 19, 2025, up 1.47% from the prior session. Markets are tightening toward year-end, driving the rally in prices.

title: U.S. Recycled Steel Prices Rise in December 2025 After Subdued Period
summary: U.S. recycled steel prices increased in December 2025 following a subdued period from May to November, driven by severe weather disruptions causing supply bottlenecks. Davis Index reported a $10 per ton rise for prime and prompt grades, with some grades up $20 per ton. Export prices from New York to Turkey also rose to $331.25 per metric ton by December 10.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,069 CNY/T on December 19, 2025, down 0.49% from the previous day, though up 0.07% over the past month. Steel rebar futures reached a two-week high above CNY 3,080 per ton amid improving margins for Chinese producers due to falling input costs. Only 35% of Chinese steel mills were profitable in November, highlighting sector pressures.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel traded at 907 USD/T on December 19, 2025, down 0.10% from the prior day, with a 0.54% monthly decline but 26.19% higher year-over-year. Forecasts predict prices at 911.35 USD/T by quarter-end and 997.25 USD/T in 12 months. The market reflects ongoing volatility with historical highs in 2021.

title: CRU: US sheet price increases open the door to import opportunities
summary: US Midwest sheet prices rose with mill price increases and extended lead times, making imports attractive, especially for HDG coils due to new AD/CVD duties on multiple countries. HDG coil prices gained notably, narrowing the spread with HR coil below $100 per short ton. Long products showed divergence, with rebar and structurals rising on data center demand.

title: China speeds up armour steel production by 30% as US Conshohocken plant folds
summary: China has increased its armour steel production speed by 30% through technological upgrades, enabling large-scale production for tanks and armoured vehicles. Meanwhile, US steelmaker Cleveland-Cliffs shut down its Conshohocken plant, which supplied military-grade steel, highlighting a growing gap in defence manufacturing capacity between the two nations. The advancements involve ultra-hard cutting tools made from cubic boron nitride to overcome production challenges.

title: Iran cuts steel imports amid surge in domestic output
summary: Iran's steel imports dropped 36% to $646 million in the eight months to November 21, driven by a 3.2% rise in domestic production to nearly 15 million metric tons in seven months. Exports surged 27% to over $4.6 billion, despite idle capacity in some sheet products. The data raises questions about continued imports amid global dumping by producers like China and Russia.

title: The Global Steel Industry 2025: At a Pivotal Crossroads
summary: Article outlines how AI, hydrogen-based processes, automation and circular-economy recycling are driving a shift toward green steel production and sustainability across markets, and argues that buyers and investors increasingly demand low‑carbon, certified steel products.

title: Global Green Steel Market to Grow at a 14.8% CAGR During 2026-32
summary: Market research press release projects strong growth for the green steel market and highlights technological drivers such as hydrogen DRI, Electric Arc Furnace adoption, and digital optimization; it names leading companies (Nucor, ArcelorMittal, Tata Steel, H2 Green Steel) and discusses policy and renewable energy factors supporting expansion.

title: CMC's 2025 Sustainability Report and ESG Leadership in the Steel Sector
summary: Coverage of Commercial Metals Company’s 2025 sustainability report, reporting energy intensity reductions, integration of renewables, circular‑economy practices (high scrap use) and claimed financial benefits from ESG-driven innovations that position CMC as a decarbonization leader in steel.

title: Steel's carbon emissions dilemma: Retrofitting plants offers big cuts
summary: Reports on a new UCL-led database and economic model (NZP‑steel) published in Nature that maps cost‑effective, plant‑specific retrofits and technology pathways to achieve net‑zero steel production, concluding that strategic retrofits plus policy support can deliver large emissions reductions across global steel plants.

title: AISI Op-Ed: Policy wins that strengthened American steel in 2025
summary: An AISI opinion piece summarizing 2025 U.S. policy and regulatory developments intended to support domestic steel competitiveness while enabling environmental progress—highlighting EPA rule revisions, permitting improvements, and regulatory adjustments for electric-arc furnaces tied to innovation and sustainability goals.

title: Copper futures hold near multi‑month highs as demand from China, US supports prices
summary: Copper futures traded around $5.41 per pound and stayed near multi‑month highs driven by strong demand from China and the US, with electric vehicles, energy infrastructure and AI‑related investment cited as key consumption drivers; the page also notes copper is up strongly month‑over‑month and year‑over‑year and referenced an all‑time high earlier in 2025.[1]

title: December 2025 Metals Options Update — Underlying copper near $5.45/lb as policy risk rises
summary: CME Group's monthly metals options bulletin reported underlying copper trading near $5.45/lb in mid‑December, with steady options volumes and rising market focus on policy risk — including a forthcoming U.S. Department of Commerce review of copper cathode imports that could lead to phased tariffs and add long‑term uncertainty to the copper market.[2]

title: Copper nears record high as supply tightness back in focus
summary: Market report noted copper climbed within about $25 of its record high after bullish forecasts (including from Goldman Sachs) emphasized tightening supply; the article highlights supply concerns as a key factor pushing prices higher.[5]

title: Copper Prices Surge to Record High on Chinese Policy and US Stockpiling
summary: IndexBox reported LME copper reached new all‑time highs in December 2025, attributing the rally to Chinese pro‑active fiscal policy for 2026 and US stockpiling ahead of potential tariffs; analysts cited in the piece warned of a potential global refined copper shortfall and strong demand from data centers and EVs.[4]

title: SMM: Copper wire & cable operating rate rises slightly MoM; transaction prices inch up
summary: Shanghai Metals Market (SMM) data summarized by Metal.com showed a slight month‑on‑month uptick in copper wire & cable operating rates and average transaction prices around 92,100 yuan/mt on December 18, 2025, indicating modest domestic demand improvement amid broader market tightness.[6]

title: Copper Stabilizes on Robust Demand
summary: Copper futures steadied near multi‑month highs as strong demand from China and the U.S. — driven by EVs, energy infrastructure and AI‑related investment — supported prices, while supply disruptions in Chile and Peru tightened market conditions.

title: Copper Rebounds on Short Covering
summary: Copper futures climbed toward $5.40 per pound after short covering and contract rollovers ahead of expiry offset weak Chinese data, with the market still showing underlying demand weakness in China despite recent price strength.

title: December 21st LME Closing: Metals Fluctuate, Copper Slightly Up
summary: LME copper prices rose slightly as a weakening dollar after U.S. data supported the metal, producing modest intraday gains amid broader metal market fluctuations reported at the London Metal Exchange close.

title: Domestic Copper Cathode Rod Operating Rate Falls to 63.06% This Week
summary: Weekly data show the operating rate for major domestic copper cathode rod producers declined to 63.06%, indicating lower domestic processing throughput which can affect short‑term supply availability for downstream industries.

title: Copper Nears Record High as Supply Tightness Back in Focus
summary: Copper prices approached record highs in 2025 as concerns over supply tightness returned to the forefront; the metal has gained sharply this year amid strong demand and constrained output, pushing market attention to production capacity and stock levels.

title: B.C. Eyes Copper Smelter to Move Up Mining Value Chain
summary: British Columbia is evaluating development of a copper smelter to add value locally, increase domestic processing capacity and address supply‑chain and national security considerations, while weighing environmental and economic tradeoffs.

title: Glencore Plans to Raise Copper Production to 1,000 kt by 2028
summary: Glencore intends to increase copper production from around 850 kilotons in 2025 to roughly 1,000 kilotons by 2028, reflecting major producers' efforts to expand capacity to meet rising demand from electrification and clean‑energy sectors.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces First Copper Production from Johnson Camp Mine
summary: Gunnison Copper reported first copper production and subsequent first sales from its Johnson Camp mine in Arizona during 2025, marking a milestone in its ramp‑up of production and potential contribution to regional copper supply.

title: Analysis: Copper set for new investment, recycling growth
summary: A McKinsey analysis projects a 3.6 million metric ton global copper shortfall by 2035, highlighting e-scrap recycling as key to meeting demand from data centers, electrification, and AI. Copper's addition to the U.S. federal critical-minerals list unlocks funding, streamlined permitting, and incentives for domestic recycling expansion. This positions recycled copper as a strategic asset amid rising demand projected to reach 42.7 million tons annually by 2035.

title: FLS wins order to supply key comminution technologies to a greenfield copper concentrator in South America
summary: FLSmidth has secured an order for advanced comminution technologies, including crushing and grinding equipment, for a new greenfield copper concentrator in South America. This reinforces FLS's leadership in mineral processing and supports sustainable mining operations aligned with their MissionZero goal of zero emissions by 2030. The technology aims to improve performance, lower costs, and reduce environmental impact.

title: Chile Swings Right: What the New Mining Era Means for Investors
summary: Chile's political shift under a right-leaning government promises expanded private participation in copper mining, streamlined regulations, and a review of state-owned Codelco to enhance fiscal sustainability. The article discusses ongoing reforms in copper taxation and environmental protections alongside lithium strategies emphasizing direct lithium extraction for sustainability. Investors may benefit from joint ventures and reduced financial pressures on key producers.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
summary: Rio Tinto's innovative Nuton technology has successfully produced its first copper, offering superior environmental performance over conventional methods. It achieves up to 80% less water usage and up to 60% lower energy consumption, advancing sustainable copper production. This milestone supports global supply needs while minimizing ecological impact.

title: USGS ends critical copper controversy
summary: The USGS has added copper to the U.S. critical minerals list, resolving long-standing debate and unlocking federal support to bolster domestic supply chains. This move provides access to grants, streamlined permitting, and procurement preferences amid growing demand. It emphasizes recycling and secondary sources for sustainability and national security.

title: WBMS releases October global production and consumption data for copper, aluminum and nickel
summary: The World Bureau of Metal Statistics reported that global refined nickel production in October 2025 was 326,400 mt versus consumption of 297,200 mt, producing a supply surplus of 29,100 mt, and a year‑to‑date surplus of 338,000 mt through October 2025[1]. The report indicates continued refined nickel oversupply amid evolving demand dynamics across stainless steel and battery sectors[1].

title: Nickel extends rebound after Indonesia signals mine output cut
summary: Nickel prices advanced following Indonesia’s proposal to cut nickel ore production for 2026, supporting a multi‑day rebound in the metal amid concerns over future supply[2]. The article notes Indonesia’s 2026 output target would fall to about 250 million tonnes from 379 million tonnes and that the government may revise the nickel ore benchmark pricing formula to treat byproducts like cobalt separately[2].

title: Weekly Review of Indonesian Nickel Market
summary: SMM’s weekly analysis reports that heavy seasonal rains have disrupted production in Indonesia’s major nickel regions and that many miners are now in the RKAB (work plan and budget) submission phase, while the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is proposing a 2026 RKAB production target cut to 250 million tonnes and a revision of the HPM benchmark to include royalties on associated minerals[4]. The piece highlights softer smelter buying due to inventories and notes limited near‑term volume releases from some mines using unused 2026 quotas[4].

title: Indonesia to cut nickel production in 2026 to maintain price stability
summary: IDN Financials reports that Indonesia plans to cut nickel production by about 34% in 2026 as a measure to stabilise prices, noting recent nickel price declines of around 7% that contributed to the move[5]. The story frames the production cut as a policy response to oversupply and falling prices in global nickel markets[5].

title: Copper nears record high as supply tightness back in focus — Markets
summary: Market coverage notes LME nickel rose for a third day after Indonesia proposed reducing nickel ore production for 2026, contributing to broader rallies in base metals as supply tightness concerns returned to the forefront[6]. The piece ties moves in nickel prices to the Indonesian policy signal and wider base metals dynamics[6].

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali completes SMP acquisition
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali, a subsidiary of Walsin Lihwa, has completed the acquisition of Sheffield-headquartered Special Melted Products (SMP), following necessary clearances and a €200 million capital increase by the company's shareholders to support the merger. The deal is presented as a strategic step to expand product mix and market presence in Europe, Asia and the US, alongside prior investments in the Aosta plant.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of its 'Green Hydrogen in Cogne' project at the Aosta plant, using a 1.008 MW AEM electrolyzer capable of producing about 165 tonnes of hydrogen per year to reduce emissions and power one furnace fully. The project is supported by €7.9 million from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan (NRRP) and aims to cut carbon emissions from steel production.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Hydrogen Central reports that Cogne Acciai Speciali has begun operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta to test electrolysis-based hydrogen production aimed at lowering carbon emissions from its stainless steel operations. The coverage highlights the plant’s role in decarbonisation efforts and aligns with the company's broader sustainability initiatives.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: In its Group Sustainability Report released for World Environment Day, Cogne Acciai Speciali states that over 94% of the Group's electricity consumption in 2024 came from certified renewable sources and highlights strong social metrics including 93% permanent contracts among employees. The release frames sustainability as central to the company strategy and notes continued commitments for 2025.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali embarks on ResponsibleSteel™ certification for Aosta site
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali announced it has started the process to obtain ResponsibleSteel™ certification for its Aosta plant, signaling a formal commitment to environmental, social and governance standards across its steel production value chain. Company leadership described the move as formalising existing sustainability efforts and part of ongoing investments in responsible practices.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel ...
summary: Italy's Antitrust Authority has initiated an investigation into major low-voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia Srl and others, for alleged price-fixing since 2005. Inspections were conducted at company offices with support from the Guardia di Finanza. Prysmian shares dropped 1.26% and Nexans fell 1.9% following the news, though analysts view the impact as negligible given the small market share.
